item.title: Xbox Game Pass January Wave 2 Features Death Stranding
item.content:encoded:
The wave 2 titles for Xbox Game Pass January 2026 have been revealed, and Death Stranding: Director’s Cut will be available to play from January 21.

It seems that Xbox Game Pass and PlayStation Plus have one matching title for January 2026, Resident Evil Village. It makes sense to release the game this month, as the next instalment to the series, Resident Evil Requiem, will be released on February 27. Check out the complete list of games added and games leaving Game Pass in January below.

Xbox Game Pass January 2026 Wave 2 Titles

There are 12 games that Xbox Game Pass subscribers can try out in January 2026. The biggest highlights from the list are Resident Evil Village, Death Stranding: Director’s Cut, and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. The likes of Death Stranding are usually available on PlayStation’s subscription service, but have now made it to Xbox Game Pass as well. This could be due to the partnership between Kojima Productions and Xbox for their upcoming title, OD.

Interested readers can check out all the games that will be added to Xbox Game Pass in January 2026 wave 2 below:

  • Resident Evil Village (Cloud, Console, and PC): Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • MIO: Memories in Orbit (Cloud, Handheld, PC, and Xbox Series X|S): Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Death Stranding Director’s Cut (Cloud, PC and Xbox Series X|S) – January 21: Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • RoadCraft (PC) – January 21: Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Ninja Gaiden Ragebound (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) – January 21: Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • The Talos Principle 2 (PC and Xbox Series X|S) – January 27: Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Anno: Mutationem (Cloud, PC, and Console) – January 28: Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • Drop Duchy (Cloud, PC, and Console) – January 28: Game Pass Ultimate, Premium, PC Game Pass
  • MySims: Cozy Bundle (PC) – January 29: Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) – January 29
  • Indika (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) – February 2: Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass
  • Final Fantasy II (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) – February 3

Games leaving Game Pass in January 2026

Several games will be leaving the service on January 31, 2026. Check out the complete list below:

  • Shady Part of Me (Cloud, PC, and Console)Cataclismo (PC)
  • Starbound (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Lonely Mountains Snow Riders (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Paw Patrol World (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Citizen Sleeper 2 Starward Vector (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap (Cloud, PC, and Console)

In other news, Fable concept art has leaked ahead of the Xbox Developer Direct. Additionally, the ad-supported Xbox Cloud Gaming tier will reportedly release in 2026. What are your thoughts on Death Stranding: Director’s Cut being added to Xbox Game Pass for January 2026 Wave 2? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about ARC Raiders fixing the out-of-map exploit through the latest patch. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Heartopia Codes: All Active Heartopia Codes & How to Redeem Them
item.content:encoded:
There is no shortage of things to do in Heartopia and, if you’re looking for a boost through progression, there are plenty of codes offering a variety of rewards to redeem.

Whether you’re just getting started in Heartopia or want to boost the currency at your disposal, Insider Gaming has details on all the active codes and how to redeem them.

All Active Heartopia Codes

Heartopia has an array of active codes to redeem to earn a tonne of rewards, including currency, crafting materials, food, and more.

Codes can only be claimed once, but provide a huge boost to your progression, along with handing you currency that can be used for the many gacha options available, which have a chance of handing you exclusive items and accessories.

The table below details all of the available Heartopia codes, and the rewards they provide.

How to Redeem Heartopia Codes

Heartopia codes are redeemed using the in-game menu and, unlike some other titles, the opption becomes available immediately after character creation.

As mentioned, codes can only be redeemed once per account, and some may have expiration dates, so it’s best to input the codes as soon as you find them.

Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to redeem codes in Heartopia.

  1. Click the Watch icon in the top-right corner of the screen.
  2. Scroll to the ‘Settings’ option and select it.
  3. Click on the ‘General’ tab.
  4. Select the ‘Redeem Code’ option, found in the bottom-right of the screen.
  5. Input the desired code and hit redeem.
  6. Collect your rewards from the mailbox outside your home.

What are your impressions of Heartopia? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, find out where to find the Resident’s Request Office, and check out which platforms the game is available on.

item.title: Will Forza Horizon 6 be on PlayStation 5?
item.content:encoded:
Forza Horizon 6 is racing onto the scene this year, but following the release of its predecessor on PlayStation 5, questions regarding platforms are already starting to appear.

If you’re a PlayStation 5 gamer and you’re looking for details on whether Forza Horizon 6 will be available on PS5, Insider Gaming has all the details.

Will Forza Horizon 6 be on PlayStation 5?

Yes, Forza Horizon 6 will be playable on PlayStation 5, Playground Games have confirmed, though it won’t be launched immediately on the console.

After the success of releasing Forza Horizon 5 on PS5, the decision to release the sequel on the PlayStation platform has been confirmed in advance of launch, and the wait will be shorter than the many years it took for Forza Horizon 5 to make the move onto the platform.

Forza Horizon 6 will, however, initially launch exclusively on Microsoft platforms on Xbox Series X|S and PC, before making a move to PlayStation at a later date.

Just like its predecessor, this will include all content and crossplay, allowing players across all platforms to play together when exploring, racing, or causing chaos.

When Will Forza Horizon 6 be on PlayStation 5?

No precise launch window has been announced for Forza Horizon 6 on PlayStation 5, with confirmation stating only that the arrival will be “post-launch”.

In the Forza Horizon 6 reveal, it was stated that, due to “the excitement for this franchise on other platforms,” Playground Games and Turn 10 Studios are “working together to bring Forza Horizon 6 to PlayStation 5 post-launch.”

While the history of Forza Horizon doesn’t provide too much of an insight, given Xbox’s approach to cross-platform launches is relatively new, other titles may provide a hint of how long PlayStation gamers will have to wait.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle was released in December 2024 on Xbox Series X|S and PC, with a PlayStation 5 version launching four months later in April 2025. Using that timeframe, expect there to be at least a few months before a PS5 launch of Forza Horizon 6.

Are you holding out for Forza Horizon 6 on PlayStation 5? Share your plans for the game in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Forza Horizon 6, check out details of the game’s location, read the alleged release date, and find out about the seasonal changes in the game.

item.title: Where Will Forza Horizon 6 Take Place? Forza Horizon 6 Location, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Forza Horizon 6 is one of the biggest games releasing from Microsoft-owned developers this year, and the series will be heading to a new location.

After an extended stint in Mexico with the last edition of the game, Insider Gaming has all the details on where Forza Horizon 6 will take place.

Where Will Forza Horizon 6 Take Place?

Forza Horizon 6 will bring the franchise to Japan, a setting that has been heavily requested by players since the first game in the series.

The setting of Forza Horizon 6 was announced by Playground Games at the Tokyo Game Show in September 2025, where it was stated that players “will get to discover a scenic and breathtaking Japan,” while the reveal trailer showed several locations, including Tokyo, Mt. Fuji, and roads lined with cherry blossom trees.

In the reveal FAQ, PlayGround Games added that “Japan has been one of the most iconic and requested locations by the community,” and that bringing the Horizon Festival to the region “has been one of our largest ambitions yet.”

Advancements in technology and design will provide players with a world that they “hope you will fall in love with,” and they can’t wait for players to “discover the beautiful landscapes and rich heritage of Japan” when Forza Horizon 6 releases.

Japan follows on from Colorado, France, Italy, Australia, the UK, and Mexico as the locations in the Forza Horizon series.

How Much of Japan Will Forza Horizon 6 Feature?

The full map size for Forza Horizon 6 in Japan has not been showcased, though it has been announced the setting will be a “region” of Japan, and not a single city or location.

Forza Horizon games usually take an area of a location and reduce its size to be smaller, allowing for a variety of biomes to be featured, which results in the likes of Forza Horizon 5 having barren desert landscapes and lush jungles. On top of this, the seasonal changes significantly tweak the look of the environment.

Tokyo is sure to feature, along with Mt. Fuji, and more details of the map, and how the size compares to previous games in the franchise, will be revealed closer to launch.

Is Forza Horizon 6 one of the games you are most excited for this year? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Forza Horizon 6, check out the alleged release date, read about the “dramatic” seasonal changes in the game, and check out details of the full reveal.

item.title: Fable Concept Art Leaks Ahead of Xbox Showcase
item.content:encoded:
A new concept leak offers players a glimpse of the Fable reboot’s locations, items, story elements, and more ahead of its official reveal at the Xbox Developer Direct.

For those unaware, Playground Games had delayed the release of the Fable reboot to 2026 last year to give the title more time. We were finally going to receive an extended look at the title at the Xbox Developer Direct this week. However, a leak has now revealed some major details ahead of the event.

Fable Leak Suggests Return to Bloodstone, a Fable 2 Location

A report by MP1ST reveals concept art for the Fable reboot, shared in an artist’s portfolio who previously contributed to the game. One of the most important finds in these images is the return of Bloodstone, a port town from Fable 2, known for housing criminals. The castle’s entry was situated between a range of mountains, which is how you might access Bloodstone in the Fable reboot.

Different areas surrounding this location were highlighted, including the Market District, Pub Island, and Arena. Some routes lead to characters like Artisan and Jacobs. The location features signs indicating it operates as a functioning town, such as one showing a man selling his fresh catch of fish and another reading “The Phoenix Feather.”

The Fable concept art leak revealed another location: a swamp village named Hamlet in the files. Two versions of this location were showcased in the artwork; one depicting its original appearance and the other illustrating the effects of a flood on the village, which could serve as a story element.

Moreover, there are images of the main character travelling through sewers and facing off against a werewolf. The werewolf’s den is filled with hanging corpses along with skulls and bones spread across the area. Lastly, there’s also an image of different versions of chests that players can acquire in the game.

Readers should note that there is no information regarding when this concept art was created, so details may change by the time the final version of the game is released. We might receive confirmation about some of these details during the Xbox Developer Direct next week.

In other news, an alleged screenshot has revealed the release date for Forza Horizon 6. What are your thoughts on the Fable reboot’s leaked concept art? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about ARC Raiders fixing the out-of-map exploit through the latest patch. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
